newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- finishes underperforming.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- finishes underperforming.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds finished Friday's session underperforming the Treasury market but still managing 3/8 to 1/2 point gains.
The government long bond was up 25/32 at 96-12/32 in late New York trading to yield 6.91 percent.
Muni futures also lagged. The June municipal contract rose 10/32 to 117, while June T-bonds gained 23/32 to 110-1/32. The MOB spread narrowed to 223 ticks from 236 at the close on Thursday.

Low supply has been the predominant market force in recent weeks, and next week's calendar shows no signs of a major pick-up. Next week is expected to see $2.2 billion in 104 sales, up slightly from this week's $2 billion in 80 sales.
The negotiated calendar totals $1.6 billion, with a $160 million Philadelphia School District issue through Merrill Lynch & Co. topping the list.
In competitive action, $618 million in 50 sales are expected.
A $200 million New York City general obligation sale on Tuesday is the largest.
In the muni secondary Friday, bids on Alliance Airport Authority, Texas, 6-3/8s of 2021 were unchanged at 101-1/2.
Jefferson County, Ala., FGIC sewer revenue bonds of 2027, which pay a 5-3/4 percent coupon, were bid at 99-1/2, up 1/4.
